meta.name: Fully Connected
meta.description: Fully connected learning layer.

meta.name: Index
meta.description:
Returns the value(s) at the chosen dimension's index of the input object. 
Can either be the exact index, a range ending at the given index, or a range starting at the given index.

meta.name: Tile
meta.description:
This operation creates a new tensor by replicating input `Tensor` `Multiples` times. The values of input `Tensor` are replicated `Multiples[i]` times along the 'i'th dimension. For example, tiling [a b c d] by [2] produces [a b c d a b c d].

`Multiples` must be a list of numbers the same length as the number of dimensions for the input tensor, and if you don't want to tile along a given dimension, use a value of 1 for that dimension's index in the `multiples` list.

meta.name: If
meta.description: Return either `If True` or `If False` based on the boolean predicate/value `Condition`.

meta.name: Dense
meta.description: Dense Layer, or more commonally called a Fully Connected layer.

meta.name: Dropout
meta.description: Dropout layer. Dropout is a regularization technique for reducing overfitting in neural networks by preventing complex co-adaptations on training data. It is a very efficient way of performing model averaging with neural networks.

meta.name: Combine
meta.description:
Combines Item 1, Item 2, etc. into a single list. If the `Mode` setting is `Extend`, it flattens any elements in the input items into a single list.

If `Mode` is `Append`, it uses each item as they are as elements in the output list.
For example, with `Item 1` = [1, 2] and `Item 2` = [3, 4], and `Mode` = `Extend`, the output is [1, 2, 3, 4]. However if `Mode` is `Append`, the output would be [[1, 2], [3, 4]].

meta.name: Target To Classes
meta.description: This will convert a single target to a list of classes for that target.
